sen.j: 『不動』（ふどう）は歌舞伎十八番の一つ。
sen.e: "Fudo" is one of the best eighteen Kabuki plays.

sen.e: The original was an act in the play "Tsuwamono kongen Soga" in which ICHIKAWA Danjuro II played at Nakamura theater in Edo in 1697.

sen.j: 大詰めに役者が不動明王に扮して出現するという単純なもので、市川團十郎の成田山信仰に由来する芸である。
sen.e: The story is simply that an actor disguised as Fudo myoo appears in the final stage and comes from the belief in Mountain Narita in which ICHIKAWA Danjuro believed.

sen.j: 現行のものは、寛保2年 (1742年) 正月、大坂 佐渡嶋座において二代目市川海老蔵（二代目市川團十郎）が『鳴神』の五幕目大切りに取り入れたものを初演とする。
sen.e: The present Fudo play was first performed by ICHIKAWA Ebizo II (ICHIKAWA Danjuro II) at Sadoshima theater in Osaka on New Year's in 1742 as the last act of the play "Narukami."

sen.e: ICHIKAWA Danjuro XII revived "Naritasan funjin fudo" in 1992 but its original is not the same of "Fudo," so it is not included in the best eighteen Kabuki plays.
